acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Original volume transferred from Amelia County Circuit Court Clerk's Office. Volumes microfilmed by the LVA ISB.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Amelia County was formed in 1734 from Prince George and Brunswick Counties.

At the conclusion of the Civil War, many African-Americans were eager to have their marital relations legally recognized. Prior to this marriages between slaves were informal and thus not considered legal. Some localities kept separate volumes to document the marriages of former slaves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The volume covers the years 1865-1869. This volume also contains the Amelia County Free Negro Register, 1855-1865.
